‘Russian laboratory’ hasn’t invented way to ‘remove black skin’

   Published on 27 March 2019
   “A Russian laboratory has invented a way to remove the black skin layer of
   black people,” a Facebook page with over 40,000 followers has posted.
The second clue is that dark skin is a result of a pigment called melanin.
It is not a separate layer of the skin that can be peeled off.

Dr Hannah Wanyika, a Nairobi-based dermatologist, also told Africa Check
   that the person in the image looks to have suffered skin injury and is not
   undergoing any skin removal process.
